intro: Astragalus tolgorensis, commonly known as Tolkens' milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, compound leaves, and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Astragalus tolgorensis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
